result.execSummary:
The defendant Ayriden I Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ayriden I Reed in court with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: 10 days jail w/Huber,Jail start date 07/25/16 at 7:00 P.M., may serve sentence in Sauk County, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:04 P.M., Defendant, Ayriden I Reed, appeared. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stating she would like counsel, 3:10 P.M. Court in recess, Court back in session at 3:33 P.M., appearances the same, Defendant filed Petition for Court appointed Atty, Court goes over information, finds defendant conditionally indigent, appoints Atty Mark Lawton, defendant to pay at the rate of $70.00 per hour, defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 1/15/16,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant, Ayriden I Reed, appeared. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty rights discussed.  Defendant does not want to proceed with the offer. Matter to be set for an argued plea/sentencing.
with not possess controlled substances without vaild Rx.  No drug paraphernalia.

Defendant, Ayriden I Reed, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $150 recog. bond with not possess controlled substances without vaild Rx.  No drug paraphernalia.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Timothy C. Henney appeared for Atty Waterman and defendant. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Henney states they have lost contact w/defendant, State requesting warrant, Court authorizes warrant
